properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Santa Fe Metro Area; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Estancia Valley; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Central Highlands; Guadalupe County; Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 2 at 10:46AM MST until January 2 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...ACCUMULATING LIGHT SNOW WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL NEW MEXICO THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON...

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches.
Locally 4 to 6 inches is possible in the southern Sangre de
Cristos and Central Highlands including Tererro, Cowles as well
as Clines Corners and Vaughn.

* WHERE...Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Jemez Mountains, Glorieta
Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Upper Rio Grande Valley,
Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Estancia Valley, Central
Highlands, Northeast Highlands, and Guadalupe County.

* WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
